title: EU bank agrees €190m loan to modernise power network in the Czech Republic
lead: As an EU Project of Common Interest, state-owned Czech Transmission System Operator, or ČEPS, will also enhance the integration of renewable energy in the network

title: CCC: ‘By early 2030s, every car, van and boiler replacement must be zero carbon’
lead: In its recommendations for the UK’s sixth Carbon Budget, the Climate Change Committee suggests the UK’s emissions must fall by almost 80% by 2035

title: SP Energy Networks to roll out ‘giant Meccano’ tech to keep lights on this winter
lead: The Emergency Restoration System can be deployed at ‘a moment’s notice’ to support both overhead and underground lines, providing a far more rapid response system for engineers to use in the field than has been previously available

title: Climate change ‘could mean Southern England’s icy days melt away by the 2040s’
lead: The Met Office predicts extremely low temperatures will only be likely to occur frequently at high altitudes in Scotland and Northern England by the 2060s

title: Haven Power is sponsoring Most Trusted Supplier (Large) at TELCA 2020 – and here’s the shortlist…
lead: This year, our industry-recognised awards show is taking place online on the 11th of December

title: Lower Thames Crossing emissions figures released in Freedom of Information request
lead: Environmentalists claim the proposed tunnel project is at odds with Boris Johnson’s pledge to cut the UK’s emissions by 68% against 1990 levels by 2030

title: Porsche and Siemens Energy team up for ‘world’s first’ hydrogen-to-eFuel project
lead: In the pilot phase of the project, around 130,000 litres of eFuels are expected to be produced by 2022

title: Ofgem minded to allow ScottishPower to claim £10.6m
lead: The amount is for the costs incurred in acting as a supplier of last resort for Extra Energy

title: Equinor and SINTEF to collaborate on offshore wind and marine solutions
lead: The companies intend to develop offshore technology that will make future projects cheaper, more efficient and more predictable

title: RIIO-2 price control: Energy Networks Association responds
lead: David Smith, CEO of the ENA said: ‘Achieving net zero emissions requires sustained investment, innovation and a supportive and forward-looking regulatory regime’
